intro: Exochaenium teuszii, commonly known as the narrowleaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in countries like South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. This perennial herb typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for grazing animals in its native habitat.
